title: Bus driver arrested after 'abandoning vehicle and fleeing police on foot'
text:

A bus driver has been arrested after allegedly abandoning his vehicle and fleeing on foot.

One witness said police officers told him the bus was pulled over because it was heading in the wrong direction.

Pictures from the scene show the bus parked up with two police cars spotted nearby.

The incident happened in Finnieston, Glasgow, at around 2.20pm this afternoon, reports Glasgow Live.

Witness Tim Bell, who was visiting a friend who works in a bar across the road, claims an officer told him the driver had "parked up and run away" from the scene.

He said: "There were about three or four police cars and 10 officers when I got there.

"I went out and had a wee chat with some of the police, they said the bus was tailed up Argyle Street because it was going in the wrong direction."

One picture showed that, when the bus lights were switched back on, the destination read Milngavie via city centre 60A, which serves a route between Easterhouse, Dennistoun and the city centre before heading to Maryhill and Milngavie.

He added: "There were five or six 'yellow vest' SPT people milling around. The bus was there for about an hour and a half before it was driven away."

Another witness, who lives nearby, claimed a man wearing "driving gear" was seen making off towards Kent Road and appeared to look unwell.

A spokesman for Police Scotland confirmed a 40-year-old man had been arrested and charged.

The statement said: "A 40-year-old man has been arrested and charged in relation to a road traffic offence following an incident on a bus that was reported around 2.20pm on Argyle Street, Glasgow, on Saturday 26 October 2019.



"A report will be sent to the Procurator Fiscal."

Duncan Cameron Operations Director for First Glasgow said: “Safety is our number one priority and we are currently working with the relevant authorities regarding an incident on one of our services on Argyle Street earlier today.”
description: Pictures from the scene show a parked up bus with two police cars nearby following the incident in Glasgow
